title: Reply if your read the 3 acts
body:
Okay, if your reading this then you've either:

a) Read the acts
b) Curiosity of what I'm going to type
c) Your a riot member and want to see what I typed (so B basically)

ANYWAY!
My thoughts on the 3 acts were pretty okay, I mean, finally Miss Fortune got revenge on Gangplank, by killing him, (sadly the act 3 part 4 doesn't tell how he dies, it only says that '_Gangplank is now dead_'.

Here are my thoughts on the act individually:

Act 1:
Nice build up to everything based on the storyline, Twisted Fate looks badass in the first Act one, part one '_Damn I'm good_' Graves meanwhile is only there for revenge on Twisted Fate, because he was left behind, that was also really cool that Riot put Twisted Fate and Graves together!!!
Also Gangplank (Act 1, Part 4), I think the author tried hard out to make Gangplank badass.

Act 2:
It's pretty straight fore ward, Gangplank is pursuit of Twisted Fate and Graves for trying to steal his be-loved sword. Meanwhile you have Miss Fortune plotting Gangplanks death. 

Act 3:
It's kinda obvious of what's gonna happen, cause everyone knew Gangplank was gonna die and Miss Fortune was gonna succeed in her plot, especially if you took into account that:

1) You've read Act 2
2) You went onto Surrenderat20.net to check out any new skins coming out and saw Captain Fortune

Continuing on, you have Twisted Fate and Graves set out their differences and come together once more and in the end:

1) Miss Fortune wants everything / everyone dead / destroyed if they're associated with Gangplank, '_I want the head of every lieutenant_'
2) Twisted Fate and Graves go to Piltover to get a new gun for Graves
3) And lastly, Gangplanks crew, ship, associates were either: Killed, destroyed and forgotten.

In conclusion to my longest discussion EVER, (and most likely my last), I would like to say, thanks Riot (mainly the authors whom made the Acts) for putting a Back Bone into this huge event.

I (and I think everyone) enjoyed reading this :D :D

It was REALLY REALLY well written, I've read whole series of well known novels that were not written as well as that, so i take my hat off to whoever wrote it!!

they should totally write LoL novels in this style, like the assassins creed franchise did.

Yup Riot stepped up the way that lore is delivered big time. I enjoyed the Freljord and Shurima narratives but Bilgewater  for me has been the best in terms or the story telling and the game modes around it. Having to choose which path to follow was difficult but that helped to add weight to the story further. 

Thanks to all the staff involved, I look forward to seeing which area will be the next focus. Maybe will will be finding out who really killed Yasuo's master in Ionia?

Cheers! I'll pass on your regards to the rest of the team.

I can't say where we'll go next in regard to an event, but the story you mention is one of a number we've had on our minds.
Didn't bother, why bother to read lore when Amumu's is a line of utter bullshit. It's obvious Riot has no lore department at all. I have absolutely no faith in Riot's writing ability.
